article_node.title: Lululemon is feeling the squeeze, and its CEO says the brand's gotten predictable
article_node.summary: Lululemon’s CEO Calvin McDonald said the brand’s product life cycles have become too long, making its casual offerings predictable and failing to excite customers. The company’s Q2 revenue missed expectations, and tariffs are expected to cut full‑year profits by $240 million. Lululemon plans to increase new styles to 35% of its assortment and refresh iconic items to regain momentum.
